bug.author: abbyearnin
bug.description:
/kind bug
Posting this to help others who may face this issue + hopefully get a quick fix on this <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kimwnasptd>@kimwnasptd</denchmark-link>
I deployed Kubeflow 0.6 by following the ISTIO method (<denchmark-link:https://master.kubeflow.org/docs/started/k8s/kfctl-k8s-istio/>https://master.kubeflow.org/docs/started/k8s/kfctl-k8s-istio/</denchmark-link> ) Most things deployed correctly, but trying to create a server in the Jupyter web app was throwing a Key Error for defaults['configurations'] . I found the fix as well, just simply added an empty value for that key in the spawner_ui_config.yaml for example: configurations:
 # fake input to bypass error
 value: "[]"
 Thanks

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label kind/bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.99. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/kubeflow/kubeflow>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.

hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/abbyearnin>@abbyearnin</denchmark-link>
By taking a look at the <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/blob/master/bootstrap/config/kfctl_k8s_istio.yaml>kfctl_k8s_istio.yaml</denchmark-link> I see that it uses this uri for the manifests: <denchmark-code>https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/archive/master.tar.gz </denchmark-code>
When I untar it, the config that gets deployed for the jupyter-web-app (manifests-master/jupyter/jupyter-web-app/base/config-map.yaml) has this key. Was the cluster that you used kfctl on a clean one or did it have a previous installation of kubeflow?
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.
